name: Dr. Michael Sun Hu
label: Optional Label
summary: Data Engineer with a PhD background, focused on building reliable data pipelines and clean, scalable architecture. I specialize in turning complex datasets into production-ready systems using Python and SQL. My approach combines academic rigor with a practical focus on data quality, automation, and cross-team collaboration to make sure data is actually useful for the business.

work_experience.summary: Designed and maintained end-to-end data architectures within the Azure ecosystem, specializing in high-performance migrations and the implementation of scalable Lakehouse environments. Responsible for the full data lifecycle, from ingestion and transformation to delivering stakeholder-ready visualizations.
highlights: Complex Pipeline Migrations: Led the migration of legacy data workflows from Azure Data Factory, Synapse, and Fabric into Databricks, improving processing efficiency and centralizing the data stack for better maintainability.

Medallion Architecture Implementation: Architected and deployed Bronze, Silver, and Gold data layers, implementing robust business logic and data quality checks to transform raw telemetry into high-value assets.
End-to-End Solution Delivery: Developed "source-to-insight" pipelines, managing the backend data engineering in PySpark/SQL and the frontend delivery through automated Power BI integration.

Business Intelligence & Reporting: Translated stakeholder requirements into interactive Power BI dashboards, providing the business with real-time visibility into key performance indicators (KPIs) and data-driven trends.

work_experience.summary: Contributed to data science projects at TomTom, focusing on geolocation data analysis, pipeline automation, and dashboard development using Databricks, Azure, and Apache Spark.
highlights: Contributed to the design and implementation of a Databricks dashboard architecture, specifically leveraging a Silver table for optimized data analysis and reporting.
Performed comprehensive analysis and visualization of extensive geolocation datasets using Databricks and Apache Spark to extract key insights and patterns.
Orchestrated and developed automated data pipelines using Azure Event Grid, Logic Apps, and Azure Functions to trigger and manage Databricks workflows.
Developed and implemented CI/CD practices and Databricks Bundles to automate and streamline the deployment of data workflows.
Contributed to enhancing and refining the overall process for calculating final metrics, including adding new features and implementing crucial fixes to improve accuracy and efficiency.

work_experience.summary: Conducted advanced research in electronics and materials science, contributing to cutting-edge projects in nanotechnology and photonics while developing innovative solutions for photovoltaic applications.
highlights: Investigated the deposition of III-nitride semiconductors by reactive sputtering.
Developed a comprehensive understanding of III-nitride on silicon heterojunction solar cell devices.

Conducted hypothesis testing, p-value calculations and outlier detection, to address anomalous data points and validate the significance of observed improvements from varied fabrication parameters on solar cell device performance.
Built a Python script (using scipy) to perform curve fitting on dark I-V curves, extracting crucial parameters for solar cell characterization.
Applied machine learning algorithms (linear regression, logistic regression, random forest regressor) to predict solar cell efficiency based on device parameters (features).
Utilized data visualization tools to communicate findings effectively (Origin, Excel, Python).

publications.title: Optimization Strategies for AlInN/Si Heterojunctions Deposited by Sputtering for Their Application to Photovoltaic Devices
publications.abstract: Doctoral research focused on optimizing AlInN/Si heterojunction solar cells through substrate nitridation, in-situ silicon deposition, and amorphous silicon buffer layers to enhance photovoltaic performance and material quality for next-generation solar cell technologies.

publications.title: Development of Amorphous AlN Thin Films on ITO-Glass and ITO-PET at Low Temperatures by RF Sputtering
publications.abstract: Successfully developed amorphous aluminum nitride thin films on flexible ITO substrates using low-temperature RF sputtering, enabling applications in flexible optoelectronic devices while avoiding thermal degradation of conductive oxide substrates.

publications.title: Enhancing Solar Cell Efficiency of AlxIn1-xN/Si Heterojunctions Using an a-Si Buffer
publications.abstract: Demonstrated 24% efficiency improvement in AlInN/Si solar cells through optimized amorphous silicon buffer layers, achieving 4.1% conversion efficiency with optimal 22% aluminum content composition.

publications.title: Amorphous Silicon Films and Nanocolumns Deposited on Sapphire and GaN by DC Sputtering
publications.abstract: Developed cost-effective DC sputtering technique for amorphous silicon films and nanocolumns on various substrates, achieving tunable optical bandgaps from 2.40 to 2.10 eV for photovoltaic applications.

publications.title: Comparison of Material Quality of AlxIn1-xN Films on Si(100) and Si(111) at Low Temperature
publications.abstract: Comprehensive comparison of AlInN film quality on different silicon crystallographic orientations, revealing similar material properties regardless of substrate orientation and demonstrating tunable bandgaps from 1.75 to 2.56 eV.
